displaydate: 1906 (stone); late 19th to first half of 20th century (rubbing)
markings:
Seal
“Fengxiang xian yin” 鳳翔縣印, sq. relief (Fengxiang is a county under the jurisdiction of Baoji 寶雞 city, Shaanxi province).
inscribed:
Zhou Mingqi 周銘旗 (1828-1913)
Col. 1:
世傳吳道子畫多長安朱繇筆。坡公所見開元寺壁上畫七百年來几幾易畫。輒隨米元章畫史載：「公藏道子畫先存
Reading notes: 
1. Zhu You 朱繇 - Five Dynasties painter in Chang’an Buddhist and Daoist subjects in the manner of Wu Daozi. 
2. Bo gong 坡公 or Gong 公 refers to Su Shi 蘇軾 (also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡, 1037-1101)
3. Mi Fu 米芾 (Mi Yuanzhang 米元章, 1051-1107), Huashi 畫史

Col. 2:
陳漢鄉家頗多碎爛，後歸鮮于子駿裝背完好，似遺公。」公詩所謂：「體質散落嗟神全」者也。此外未之聞焉。余再搉鳳翔購
Reading notes: 
1. Xianyu Zijun 鮮于子駿 was an acquaintance of Su Shi 蘇軾 (1037-1101).
2. See Su Shi, 《仆曩于长安陈汉卿家见吴道子画佛碎烂可惜其后十余年复见之于鲜于子骏家则已装背完好子骏以见遗作诗谢之》829页；806页（七古）
　　贵人金多身复闲，争买书画不计钱。已将铁石充逸少，（殷铁石，梁武帝时人。今法帖大王书中有铁石字。）更补朱繇为道玄。（世所收吴画，多朱繇笔也。）烟薰屋漏装玉轴，鹿皮苍璧知谁贤。吴生画佛本神授，梦中化作飞空仙。觉来落笔不经意，神妙独到秋毫颠。我昔长安见此画，叹惜至宝空潸然。素丝断续不忍看，已作蝴蝶飞联翩。君能收拾为补缀，体质散落嗟神全。志公仿佛见刀尺，修罗天女犹雄妍。如观老杜飞鸟句，脱字欲补知无缘。问君乞得良有意，欲将俗眼为洗湔。贵人一见定羞怍，锦囊千纸何足捐。不须更用博麻缕，付与一炬随飞烟。
http://www.readers365.com/hualun/hl142.htm 

Col. 3:
得道子畫册於城北何氏家，素絲斷續，墨色如新，款識亦殊，与今别千年。神俊照耀寰區，良堪寶貴。册几八頁揀其完而無

Col. 4:
缺者得四頁，亟[]公諸同[]，余少尉國崇善雙鉤法，請其摹勒上石，嵌東湖坡公遺祠壁間。公之靈其默鑒之視朱繇[]作
Reading notes:
1. Shaowei 少尉, refers to a District Jailor (dianshi 典史) in the Qing dynasty. Guo Chong 國崇 may be that official’s name. 

Col. 5:
何如視開元寺壁上[]鮮于子駿以[]公者又何如也。光緒丙午端陽前一日古[]其周銘旂并識。
Reading notes:
1. Zhou Mingqi 周銘旗（旂）(1828-1913), 字懋臣，号海鹤，为现青岛市即墨区龙山街道大留村人。

makers.displaymaker: after wall paintings by Wu Daozi 吳道子, active ca. 710 - 760

texts.textentryhtml:
Four pictorial scenes with a red seal of Fengxiang county 鳳翔縣 stamped in top center, and with a five-column inscription at left. The upper right scene shows man seated on a mat near a tree. He carries a pot in his left hand from which smoke rises and turns into a dragon at left. The lower right scene shows a large figure seated in a cave. In front of the cave is a pine tree at left, a smaller figure kneels paying respect at right. In the scene at upper right, in a rocky landscape a man sits on a stone accompanied by a tiger. The scene at lower right depicts a man seated by a stream near a pine tree. He looks across the stream at a waterfall.


The pictorial stones from which this rubbing was taken is presently located in the stele corridor of the Fengxiang Museum 鳳翔博物館 in Shaanxi province. The stones were engraved by Zhou Mingqi in 1906 and originally installed in the Su Wenzhong Shrine 蘇文忠公祠 at East Lake in Fengxiang. “Wenzhong” is the posthumous title of Su Shi 蘇軾 (1037-1101). The 1906 inscription by Zhou Mingqi records that the model for the pictorial images were ink on silk paintings by the Five Dynasties painter Zhu You that copied wall paintings by the Tang dynasty painter Wu Daozi. According to Mi Fu’s 米芾 (1051-1107) Hua shi 畫史 (Painting history), Su Shi owned these paintings after they had fallen into bad condition when in the possession of Chen Hanxiang 陳漢鄉, and then were subsequently remounted by Xianyu Zijun 鮮于子駿, an acquaintance of Su Shi. Zhou Mingqi reports that he purchased the paintings in the form of eight album leaves from a He 何 family living to the north of Fengxiang. From the eight, he selected four leaves that were more complete, and asked the official Guo Chong 國崇, who excelled at the double-outline method (shuanggou 雙鉤), to be cut them into stone. He then installed them in the shrine for Su Shi by East Lake.

bibliography.boilertext: "Recent Acquisitions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 18, no. 1 (1959): p. 40-42.
bibliography.citation: "Recent Acquisitions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 18, no. 1 (1959): p. 40-42., p. 42

caption: Chinese, Qing dynasty (1644–1912), Zhou Mingqi 周銘旗, carver (1828–1913), after wall paintings by Wu Daozi 吳道子 (active ca. 710 - 760), Luohan figures, 1906 (stone); late 19th to first half of 20th century (rubbing). Sheet; ink rubbing on paper; 81 x 88 cm (image), 63.8 x 83 cm. Gift of George Rowley (y1958-294)
